Posts.Content: RNRB1 wrote: Hi, I just had a lumpectomy and am 48 years old. Took out 7 lymph nodes and all were negative. I am er/pr negative with a tumor the size of 1.7 cm I believe. Mine was ductal invasive. Doctor reported margins were clean but close. I am thinking she may want to do another surgery but will find out on Wed. My cells were grade 3 but I am unaware of my stage is. Has anyone else had close margins? What happened? Does anyone know about chemo and what kind or how long since I am negative and it is grade 3 but small. Are they usually agressive with this? Help! I am new to all of this and bombarded with info. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: After lumpectomy RNRB1 VickiTN

Posts.Content: May 6, 2007 12:07PM RNRB1 wrote: Thank you. I am trying to prepare myself. It has been difficult---I am sure people look back and can relate. I don't know how to plan my life. I do good then get bad news then fall to pieces again. Is there life after this? When?
Posts.Title: After lumpectomy RNRB1 VickiTN

Posts.Content: May 6, 2007 06:56PM RNRB1 wrote: I am sorry to hear that. I know that it is common, but I don't know anyone really that is living close to me going through this. A lot of information to take in.
